reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we felt like we were relaxing in the country house of old friends rather than staying in a hotel. Every area is beautifully decorated but homely, and the staff could not be more helpful. The rooms are lovely. We stayed in a standard room one night (which being on the first floor had beautifully high windows and was very light but had only a shower, no bath) then one the next stage up, which had a bath but smaller windows as it was in the attic. Both were gorgeous. We ate in the pub one night and the restaurant the next, and actually preferred the relaxed atmosphere of the pub overall but the food was excellent in both. I could not recommend this place more highly, if you are thinking of staying there, then definitely go for it!
reviews.title: Best hotel for relaxing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Each component part of this hotel is strong yet somehow they are not working together to create the promised luxury package. The house is fantastic - soooo tastefully furnished, and the general ambiance is one of chic, relaxed country house living. The food is great - a fantastic steak and chunky chips, generous portions and cooked just as I asked. My girl- friend had fish which was cooked to perfection. Have the ice cream - it is yum! My only gripe and it is only a very tiny one about the food is that I would have enjoyed the side salad better had it been served on a separate plate. The staff are warm and friendly. The room was smallish and the bath was a real disappointment - much too small for what I am looking for in luxury accomodation. Bedding fantastic - crisp, white linen and soft duvet. So...what didn't work. Essentially what would bring all these component parts together are staff who link them all up. We sat in the lounge and had to ask for afternoon tea - this was despite staff having come in a couple of times, looked around and then going out again without checking whether there was anything we required. Staff brought the tea in and didn't wipe the table down which was dirty from the mess left by previous guests. We then wanted a drink before dinner and had to find staff to serve us. The fire almost went out and as it got colder we chose to go and find staff to advise them of this as there were no logs in the basket for us to keep the fire stoked. That is not what I am looking for on a luxury break. I want staff to be vigilant and attentive to the needs of guests, I want them to pre-empt my requests and be working to create an atmosphere which is cosy, warm and where my having to ask for things is kept to a minimum. This experience will not put me off going again but I do hope that staff have some training/input to help them better align the way they take up their role with what the business is meant to deliver.
reviews.title: Rectory almost delivers on the luxury package promised:

likes.disliked: — Staff not confident in their role.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice hotel with a nice dinner menu. Our room was very nice and the bathroom was of good size. I thought the dining room funiture could stand an upgrade. The grounds are very nice and deserve taking the time to walk around. Over all a very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary, having had to cancel a trip to Rome due to a family bereavement. The hotel was featured in Red magazine and also appears on the Mr & Mrs Smith website.
reviews.title: Shabby chic

likes.disliked: — The lack of drinks in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had one of the "superior" rooms, which had some pretty old furniture in it, hence the "shabby chic" epithet above! It was a decent size and the bathroom was nice. As someone else mentioned you have to ask if you want tea/coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: A mixed bag

likes.liked: — Interesting old building in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cosy hotel with funky decor and very friendly service. The food was generally very good and the cooked breakfast was excellent. Only downside was that our room (Nibley) was a bit pokey, but it didn't matter too much as we made good use of the other areas in the hotel. The Potting Shed pub just across the road also provided a great alternative to dining in the hotel. Would definitely recommend this place to friends.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited the Rectory with the wife and young baby for a short midweek break and really enjoyed ourselves....the staff couldn't do enough for us!! The hotel looks impressive from the outside and even more impressive on the inside. The food in the restaurant was wonderfully presented and the service was impeccable.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, extremely relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a wide selection of DVD's if you just want to chill out in your room for a while as well as loads of magazines to read ...ideal with a glass of champagne in the bar!
reviews.title: The moment you drive through the old stone pillar entrance to The Rectory you know you have arrived somewhere special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We also ate at the Potting Shed pub at the end of the road one night and the food and the ambience were fantastic....highly recommended especially the rabbit pie!!
reviews.title: Nice,but known better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Westonbirt Arboretum one day which is about 25 minutes from th hotel and this ime of year was an exlosion of colour. We also went to Tetbury for a mooch around which if you like antique shops is an absolute must. Quayles delicatessen on the roundabout in the middle of the village was a great find for a cup of tea and a sandwich.
reviews.title: Lets just say - I wouldn't not go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the Rectory is a recent refurbishment and rebranding of a previous establishment. It's been done in the modern, chic style that would be familiar to readers of the Mr & Mrs Smith guides.
reviews.title: lovely secluded and romantic hotel

likes.disliked: — there are few amenities in Crudwell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The shared areas of the hotel are beautifully designed without feeling overdone. You can play boules in the large garden at the back and there's a swimming pool for residents' use only.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend break

likes.disliked: — Rooms could do with some attention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast - excellent - is in the restaurant, as of course is dinner if you choose to eat in the hotel. If not, the only other choice in Crudwell is the Potting Shed pub which is also a recent refurb and is run by the owners of the hotel. In fact you can have your bill from the pub added to your hotel bill which is quite convenient.
reviews.title: Idyllic country pad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom was nice with a lovely view across the garden and the church (for which this was once of course the rectory). I would say that the standard of decoration while perfectly acceptable was not quite of the highest level you might expect in a top-end boutique hotel. But then again, nor are the prices. There was a radio with iPod dock on the bedside table, which is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Beautfiul Country Break

likes.disliked: — The pool not being in working order

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, myself and our two sons age 5 and 2 have just returned from a lovely 2 night stay at The Rectory. I took my husband for his birthday and figured we would stay there for 2 nights rather than just one night at Babington House for the same price. The Rectory is cosy yet modern and the rooms spacious. We stayed in 2 different rooms and actually preferred our second, cheaper room to the first as it was in the eves and was airy and bright. The staff were friendly and helpful and the food of a surprisingly high standard with all produce locally sourced. Our children were made to feel welcome with the chef cooking their dinner specially for them both nights. They enjoyed running around the gardens, playing the hotels board games and watching the borrowed DVDs. We had a lovely day out to the Abotoreum nearby. My only fault with the hotel was that some of the rooms could do with a lick of paint and some attention, particularly the ceilings and window ledges and some peeling wallpaper. There were also an unusually excessive amount of flies around the restaurant and in the bedrooms. Otherwise though it was very clean. For just over £500 for a family of 4 for 2 nights including an excellent breakfast and dinner I think this hotel is great value for a relaxing break and would thoroughly recommend it.
reviews.title: The sublime Rectory!

likes.liked: — The room, the food, the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable old country house hotel run by a friendly young team of staff. The feeling is that you are visiting a home rather than a hotel, with wellies in the porch, cricket stuff in the hall and books in the bedrooms. Spacious room and bathroom, plenty of hot water for the deep old fashioned bath. None of the furniture matched in our room which only added to the charm. The hotel has a lovely walled garden plus outdoor swimming pool (not heated when we were there). This is an old rectory right next door to the church and the clock chimes on the hour and half hour, we loved this but could be a problem for light sleepers.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotels sells itself on the quality of its food which is locally sourced. To be honest we were a little disappointed with the meat we were served. My husband's lamb was so fatty he couldn't eat it ,and given the price of my steak I felt it should have been melt in the mouth whereas it was chewy.
reviews.title: Wiltshires secret boho chic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only other criticisms, the mattress on our king size four poster bed was comfortable but the bed squeaked and the towels were far from soft. Overall however we enjoyed our stay and would go back if we were in the area.
reviews.title: very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic find - will definitely be back - great balance of personal feel and great service. Small intimate hotel (think 12 bedrooms) - stayed in 'Crickley Room' on the top floor - and was real treat. Massive bed and great views. Great sash windows. Pool was little too cool for a dip for us - but hey - we are lightweights!
reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable, good food, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: stayed with the wife and dog without our kids for a wind down w/e. it was really very good. everything was how we hoped it would be. quiet and peaceful. nicely decorated - not too modern or too chintzy. food - we have pretty high standards and were very pleasantly surprised. everything was well cooked, perfectly seasoned and well thought out. overall very impressed. don't go if you are looking for uber luxurious pampering but if you want a chilled out and relaxed stay in a charming house with proper food and efficient discreet service give it a go.
reviews.title: Excellent for couples with children
